name: Kubernetes Dashboard - Legacy - KSM, cAdvisor,nodemetrics Supported

data.name: Kubernetes Dashboard - Legacy - KSM, cAdvisor,nodemetrics Supported
data.description: View of key metrics relating to the health and performance of Kubernetes.Please note that alerts in this package are limited to support for coralogix helm chart only & not nodemetrics,ksm or cAdvisor

markdown.markdownText:
![image.png](data:image/png;base64,)

### Kubernetes Observability Dashboard

This customizable dashboard provides comprehensive insights and real-time monitoring of your Kubernetes clusters, offering unparalleled visibility into the health and performance of your workloads and nodes. This dashboard tracks key metrics such as resource utilization, pod status, node availability, and network traffic to ensure optimal Kubernetes performance and reliability.

Benefits:
Improved Resource Management: Proactive monitoring helps optimize the allocation of CPU, memory, and disk resources across nodes and pods, ensuring efficient utilization and performance.
Enhanced Cluster Health: Early detection of potential issues minimizes downtime and ensures that nodes and pods remain healthy and responsive.
Optimized Costs: Gain insights into resource utilization and cluster scaling to avoid unnecessary resource consumption and reduce operational costs.
Streamlined Operations: Centralized monitoring simplifies cluster management, facilitating quick identification of issues and improving operational efficiency.
Comprehensive Overview: This dashboard ensures effective management and optimization of Kubernetes environments, enhancing performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency.

**Note:** Make sure that kube-state-metrics are properly configured and successfully sent to your Coralogix Account for monitoring and analysis.

### Use Cases Covered

* **Cluster Overview**: Monitor key metrics like node count, pod count, and cluster health to get a comprehensive view of your Kubernetes environment's current state.
* **Resource Utilization**: Track CPU, memory, and disk usage across nodes and pods to ensure efficient resource allocation and prevent bottlenecks or over-provisioning.
* **Node Health Monitoring**: Keep track of node status and readiness to ensure optimal availability and performance of your Kubernetes cluster.
* **Pod Lifecycle**: Monitor pod creation, deletion, and error states to ensure workloads are running as expected and to troubleshoot issues quickly.
* **Network Traffic**: Analyze network traffic and packet flow between nodes, services, and external endpoints to identify potential network issues and ensure proper connectivity.


You can modify the widgets by clicking on the widget you want to customize and editing the query in the bottom query bar to tailor the monitoring system to your specific needs.

promqlQuery.value: count(kube_node_info{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}"}) by (k8s_cluster_name, node, kubelet_version, container_runtime_version)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (rate(container_memory_working_set_bytes{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (rate(container_memory_usage_bytes{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
sum by (pod) (rate(container_memory_usage_bytes{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}", namespace=~"{{namespace}}", pod=~".+"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
avg by (pod) (increase({__name__=~"container_network_.+_errors_total",k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}", node=~"{{k8s_node_name}}"}[1m])) or on() vector(0)
count(count by (pod, k8s_cluster_name) (kube_pod_container_status_running{k8s_cluster_name=~"{{k8s_cluster_name}}"})) by (k8s_cluster_name) or on() vector(0)
